VisitSongkhla EN ////ButtomNavi//// Main Travel Check-in Maps ////CHOOSEN//// Welcome VisitPattani Every trip in your hands Language Thai English Let\'s Go ////HOME//// Attraction Find More+ Theme Find More+ Restaurant Find More+ ////HOME-Detail//// GENERAL PREM PARK The area of General Prem Park is 150 rai. It is located on the Public Route No. 408 at the bridge connecting to KohYor. The multi-purposed building was built for commemoration and being an international seminar hall. Later, it has been adapted to be the historical hall of General PremTinsulanonda. The surrounding landscape was improved to be the public park, the swamping forest learning center, the camping area, and relaxation area. It is one of the most important tourist attractions of the province. Mr. BanyatSenasana,the governor of Songkhla Province at that time, with his team including government sectors, private sectors, and local people is the center of construction.The area is divided according to the usage into 3 parts.-The first area consists of Historical Hall of PremTinsulanonda, the former prime minister and the statesman.-The second area consists of public park, outdoor sculptures, a botanical garden, palm sugar garden, water pool in the garden, natural outdoor grandstand, outdoor cultural space, and beverage shop, pier building shops, pier building, and aquatic tourism center.-The third area consists of ecology learning center of swamping forest, a 800-meter ecotourism walk way, 4 exhibition pavilion for studying swamping forest, a camping area for students, collegians, and general people, and learning center (11th Industrial Support Center), Staff accommodation, and plant nurseries.The park is opened from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. The Historical hall is opened on Wednesday – Sunday from 9.30 a.m. to 4.30 p.m. and closed on Monday – Tuesday. Accommodations, tents, conference rooms, and garden tram are provided. Phawong, Mueang Songkhla District, Songkhla KHAO TANG KUAN It is a high mountain which is about 2,000 feet from sea level. From the peak of the mountain, you can see the scenery of Songkhla town. ChediPhrathat Koo Muang, a Buddha relic of Songkhla Province that was built in Nakhon Sri Thammarat Empire, is situated on the peak of the mountain. It is in Dvaravati art style (on the mountain, about 2,000 feet above sea level.) King Mongkut (King Rama IV) gave his own money to repair this temple. In 1996, King Bhumibol (King Rama IX) gave the Buddha relics to locate in the pagoda. The ceremonies called “Hom Pa OngChedi”, “Tak Bat Thevo”, and “Lark Phra” of Songkhlaare held every October.Attractions of the peak of Khao Tang Kuan1.ChediPhrathat2.The lighthouse3.SalaPhraViharnDaeng4.The viewpoint of Khao Tang KuanTo visit Khao Tang Kuan:Khao Tang Kuan is situated in Muang District of Songkhla near Samila Beach. You can take a red minibus or a TukTuk motorcycle in the town to Khao Tang Kuan.There are 2 ways to go to the peak of Khao Tang Kuan.-Use the elevator at the junction road between Khao Tang Kuan and KhaoNoi. The fee is 30 baht for adults and 20 baht for children. It is opened from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. on Monday-Friday and from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. on Saturday, Sunday, and public holidays.-Use the stair on the west side which is opposite to the elevator. Ther-There are stone stairs and many rest points and viewpoints. You can see the scenery from many levels. There is 145 steps from Naka Stairs to ViharnDaeng. in Muang District LAEM SAMILA Leam Samila is best known for its powdery-sand beach, shady pine groves and is where Songkhla’s most famous mermaid statue is located. The beach is easily accessible either by Hat yai-Songkhla buses or takes the minibus from the city directly to the beach. in the City Municipality about 2.5 kilometers away from Thalat Supsin or Thalat Sot Thetsaban (fresh market) SONGKLA OLD TOWN Songkla Old Town is located in the area of Mueang District with three important roads interesting for travelling; that is, NakornNok Road (Out of town road), NakornNai Road (Inside the town road) and Nang Ngam (beauty queen road). Dating back to 200 years ago, the city of Songkla was located at the West of the Lake of Songkla called “City of Songkla of the Son Cape Side” till 2358 B.E. it was extended to the East in the area of Bo Yang Subdistrict called “City Songkla of the Bo Yang Side”. At the very first, there was two roads; that is, NakornNok Road which was the outer road next to the Lake of Songkla and NakornNai Road which was the road in town, later the third road was built called the road of nine rooms or Town of nine rooms to the celebration of town pillar which later was called the Beauty Queen road.Nowadays, NakornNok road, NakornNai road and Nang Ngam road still maintain traditional uniqueness. There are Chinese row houses, Chino-Portuguese classical Buildings, The spirit house of Guan Yu, Nang Ngam Hotel (the hotel of beauty queen), ancient wooden hotel decorated with exquisite wooden-engraved pattern, including Hokkien Chinese row houses mingled with other buildings along both sides of the road. Some buildings was renovated by newly painted; however, they were not changed in structure, reflecting on the important city in terms of politic and economy dating back to the Thonburi Era. Morevoer, it is the town next to sea leading to being influenced by culture from various races mixing with specific culture of Songkla. Though, today, modern trade is moved to the center base at Had Yai District, all the ancient building remaining throughout the town signifies the prosperity in the old days and long-lasting harmonious many kinds of culture.Apart from seeing ancient buildings, we can see and taste a lot of delicious Thai, Chinese, international desserts in Songkla Old Town including a number of folk souvenir. Especially on Nang Ngam road or previously named the road of nine rooms, it is filled with local food and dessert which are famous and unique of the road. There are Thai dessert, ice-cream shop, old coffee shop, steamed dumpling store. You should not miss trying Loy Island rice porridge, stew rice of Kietfangshope (Koyao) which is Chinese stew rice eating with hot steamed dumpling or pigtail noodles, duck noodle and Vietnamese sausage, Two-million shop selling Sampannee, Ki-Mod, Thong Eke, stirred millet, Tien Sod dessert which are old dessert hardly seen in these days. Nakhonnai, Amphoe Mueang Songkhla. SONGKHLA OLD TOWN WALL Songkhla Old Town Wall built in 1836 in Rama III period by have mandate Songkhla governor to move city from Leam Son to Bor Yang. This wall built finish in 1842 (total 6 years). Cause of delay is rebellion at Malay city in 1838. It located farm from water around 40 meters. The length from east to west of town wall is 1,200 meters and from north to south is 1,000 meters. There are totally 8 fortress and 10 city gates. City gate is the large arch, width 3 meters and height 6 meters. Arch has feature of Chinese roof. After a long period, town wall was declined and deteriorated. But always have repair and restore. During 1894-1905 there was command to dismantle for take bricks to build and improve road. Later explored important archaeology materials which are stele bury under fortress. Suppose that it use for exorcise spirit and destroy black magic. In year 2011 had heavy storm and caused town hall collapse and restore by Fine Arts Department. Bo Yang, Mueang Songkhla District. HATYAI CITY PARK Hatyai City Park is located on Kanjanavanich Road, Hat Yai District. It is a recreation area of Hat Yai and neighboring districts. Whole mountain area was modified to be a shady park with many trees in an area of 900 rai Kanjanavanich Road, Hat Yai District. NAMTOK TON NGA CHANG Considered as one of the most beautiful waterfalls in the south, Namtok Ton Nga Chang [Elephant’s tusks waterfall] is located in the Ton Nga Chang Wildlife Sanctuary, just 26 kilometers away from the city. From all seven levels of the waterfalls, the best part located on its third levels where the stream is separated into two akin to the elephant’s tusks which gives name to the waterfall. Treks also provided for more adventurous experience. By driving, follows the Hat Yai – Rattaphum Road for 13 kilometres then turn left at Ban Hu Rae for another 13 kilometres. One can also hire the motorized tricycle (tuk-tuk) or the minibus from the fresh market (Talat Sot Thetsaban Hat Yai) at 300-400 THB which will takes 2-3 hours to the waterfall. Thung Tam Sao, Hat Yai District Gim Yong Market Charm of Gim Yong MarketGim Yong Market is one of the attractions that shows the characteristics of Hatyai. It is the center of goods in all range of prices; the goods are cheap and there are many choices to choose from. The market is filled with food, toys, clothes and fruits. Area of the market is big and divided into 2 floors; downstairs contains of food, snack, perfume, watches, electric appliances and etc. and upstairs is the zone for electric appliances such as VCD, car stereo. The prices are various to choose for what suits the buyers. The market opens in the morning until evening. It's considered as the biggest place for souvenirs in Hatyai.“Gim Yong Market is considered as an important area of local economy because the majority of tourists; Thai, Malaysian or Singaporeans, would visit here when they come to Hatyai. Hatyai is also renowned for the import goods from Malaysia. Other than Gim Yong market, there is another market nearby names Santisuk Market. It is said that if people do not come here when they visit Hatyai, they do not arrive at Hatyai.lt is the center for legendary food of Hatyai which are Hatyai Fried Chicken and local food like tea or originalChinese beverages. Why does it name “Gim Yong”?The Chinese man, Shi Gim Yong is the oldest son of Shi Yi San (who was honored as Lord Supasal), has a sharp mind, kind heart and a far vision unlike others. Hat Yai downtown SONGKHLA ZOO Located on the Songkhla-Chana Road in Tambon Khao Rup Chang, Songkhla Zoo is an open-range zoo established by the aim to preserve and return the wild animals to nature. The hilly area of the zoo is paved as an asphalt ring road where tourist can drive along the way to see various animals grouped separately such as camels, birds, bantengs, tigers and crocodiles. The not-to-be-missed highlight perches atop of the zoo is the viewpoint to catch the city view with food stalls are also available. Opening hours: Daily from 8:30am-5pm. Khao Rup Chang, Mueang Songkhla, Songkhla 90000, Thailand SONGKHLA AQUARIUM Songkhla Aquarium is located on the tip of Son On Cape, Bor Yang sub-District, Muang District. It was established by Songkhla Municipality to be a marine life’s biology and behavior learning center for youth and general people, aquatic resources and environment preservation, and relaxation place of people. There are Thailand’s largest and the most abundant catfish which are over 200 kilograms heavy. There are also leopard sharks and beautiful fish living in coral area. There are various exhibitions in the aquarium including fish tunnel, ecology exhibition, mountains, rivers, freshwater animals, swamp forest, beaches, marine animals, Ao Thai Sea, marine resource usage, exhibition space, seminar rooms, restaurants, and souvenir shops. Songkhla Aquarium exhibits fish feeding show by divers every day. Visitors will learn the correct and exciting fish feeding. The divers will feed giant catfish which are over 200 kilograms heavy, leopard sharks which are lovely and friendly with the divers, marbled whiprays which are over 3 meters wide, and other middle-sized fish.Songkhla Aquarium is the learning center of marine lives. You will learn the history and lifestyle of each fish which is the valuable knowledge. Bor Yang sub-District, Muang District. NanYuan Chinese food / Noodles Tanrattanakorn Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110 Chokdee Tae Tiam Dim Sum / Chinese food 58/25 Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110 Kai Tod Decha Thai food 4135 Khuan Lang, Hat Yai District, Songkhla 90110 Kenta Hatyai Sushi/ Japanese food 228/42-44 Supasarnrangsan Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110 Nam Khiang Din Restaurant Sea food/ Thai food 313 Supasarnrangsan Rd, Tambon Hat Yai, Amphoe Hat Yai, Chang Wat Songkhla 90110 ////MENU//// Highlight New Theme Package Diary Restaurant Hotel Shop Help //// HIGHLIGHT //// Popular places Guide by Google //// NEWS //// Event Festival //// THEMES //// Nature History Art and Culture //// Restaurant //// General Food Halal Food ////CHOOSEN-Location//// Capital District Hat Yai District Other Districts //// Diary //// Questionnaire Check-in History //// Form Diary //// Name Surname Email Age Manage Please Wait...
